page.title: 06FENSTANTON CLOCK TOWER
page.content: {In the High Street of Fenstanton there is a{clock tower}about 350 years old.It has two sides to the clock tower;on the left is a{jail}and on the right are the{clock workings. {PRISON-}People who roamed the streets of Fenstanton,where thrown in the prison for the night.There were bunks in the jail for people to sleep on. { CLOCK TOWER WORKINGS-}Inside the clock tower there are two heavy weights,there is also an old drive (something to make the clock work). This was made by Peacocks,Huntingdon. {The present workings are from {Conington Hall.} {The Clock Tower}at various times has been used as a market hall,a lock up and even for a stray cattle pound. {Today}the clock tower is looked after by{Mr Hobbs the post {master.
